data.name: Nagarkot Sunrise View and Day Hiking from Kathmandu
data.price: from $85.00 per adult (price varies by group size)
data.about:
A mountain village in Nepal, Nagarkot is famous for its sunrise views over the Himalayas. On this tour from Kathmandu, enjoy an early morning panorama over world-renowned peaks before a scenic hike to Changu Narayan. Visit other villages as you make your way through the country‚Äôs picturesque hillsides before arriving at the UNESCO-listed temple. A private guide means plenty of personal attention, and hotel pickup makes for a seamless experience.The trip was good but harder than we expected. We were told it would be downhill, but there were some challenging uphill parts. The hike was described as easy, while it may be an easier hike in this area, it was much more challenging for us as tourists than we expected. Madan was helpful, encouraging and willing to slowdown and help up navigate the tougher parts of the trails. Our driver was great at navigating the fog in the morning and the traffic in the afternoon. Although we couldn‚Äôt see the mountains at sunrise, it was still a great experience and worthwhile view. Overall, it was a good day, but we think the description of the hike could be a little more accurate. Nepali ‚Äòeasy‚Äô is very different than American ‚Äòeasy‚Äô. It ended up being over 7miles from the start of the official hike to the end with a significant ‚Äòhill‚Äô we had to hike up in the middle.Namaste Elizabeth,

Thank you very much for sharing your review. We are sorry that you found this hiking journey to be difficult and couldn't witness mountains at sunrise. But we would love to welcome you back again with easier tours in Nepal. We are glad that our guide Madan was very helpful. Have a nice time!Very good hike with beautifull view and sunrise! Very good guide, Somnath, and the hike was good length, not too long. Thank you!Namaste Esben,

Thank you very much for sharing your review. Glad to know that you loved this trip with our guide Somnath. Love to welcome you back again. Have a nice time!Our guide Shishir took us through a beautiful path across Nagarkot. We experienced great terrain, culture and a beautiful Buddhist Garden.Namaste Meenu,

Thank you very much for sharing your review. Glad to know that you loved this trip with our guide Shishir. Love to welcome you back again. Have a nice time!Today I went on a sunrise and hiking trip to Nagarkot. The trip was perfectly organized and my guide Shishir was just perfect. He speaks English fluently and he has an enormous knowledge about nature, history, religion and culture.  It was a pleasure talking to him.  I can recommend this trip to everybody. Namaste!

Thank you very much for sharing your review. Glad to know that you loved this trip our guide Shishir. Love to welcome you back again. Have a nice time!The sunrise view was good, but the best part was the walk through the nearby villages and stops at the temples. Was a great chance to glimpse a side of nepal outside the city and trekking.Namaste!

Thank you very much for sharing your review. Glad to know that you loved the hiking part with our guide. Love to welcome you back again. Have a nice time!Not as advertised - the lookout point is dangerous at best.  The hike through picturesque villages is non-existent.  No places to stop and see the vistas.  No places to eat and mingle as advertised.  Guide was on phone most of the time.  Complete waste of moneyHi Aaron,

Thank you very much for your superb feedback about the trip and we are sorry for the any inconvenience. Regarding the view we can not guarantee for weather clearance, it is depend on a season and i am sure your day has a poor visibility. Besides this we are well concerned about the guide service. He did a thousand of trip not sure why he was not caring you. We will take necessary action and aware him for his upcoming duty and we trust that this won't be happen again. Have a nice stay in Nepal. Namaste!Walked about 13 kms through different villages. The guide knew the area very well. The breakfast after the sunrise was at a wonderful hotel with fascinating views. Pick up and drop was as sceduled. No delayes. Madan is a good asset for a company. I felt how he felt responsible during whole tour and explained the details without hesitation. Thank you once againHi Eka,

Thank you very much for being with us and glad to know you loved this trip with our guide Madan. If you feel longer trip in future feel free to contact us and we would love to serve you again. Namaste!A huge thanks to our tour guide Shishir and driver Sundes ! We had a magical time watching the sunrise. Shishir even brought us some wild raspberry‚Äôs! I am the type of person who likes to watch the sunrise for a long time so I was very grateful that he never hurried us for the next schedule and let us stay to watch the sunrise for the longest time.Unfortunately we couldn‚Äôt see the Himalayan mountains but it was still a very nice sunrise.Also the hiking was a wonderful adventure where we saw many dogs, goats and chickens and really see the village life.He explained a lot of the scenery with many interesting facts. Unfortunately after hiking for a while I was suddenly feeling unwell and nearly fainted.Shishir asked our driver Sundes to come to the closest point available to pick us up and helped me go to a local cafe to lie down for a while.I really appreciate their help and their kindness. If not for the two of them, me and my friend wouldn‚Äôt have felt safe.They made our first trip to Kathmandu very very special despite feeling unwell. Thankyou so much and hope to see u again soon!!Namaste!

First of all thank you for choosing us as your local operator here in Kathmandu and glad to know our guide able to offer you good service and information. Your safety is our first concern and glad to know our guide able to provide you on time service while needed. We love to serve you again in the future. Have a nice time in Nepal. Namaste!Our day in Nagarkot with Pankaj was one of the best day trips we‚Äôve ever had! Pankaj is kind, intelligent, patient and interesting. We learned so much! Three of us signed up and we were surprised to find out we had Pankaj to ourselves all day! This trip is an excellent value. The highlight was spending time talking with Pankaj while walking through the hill villages on the way down from a wonderful breakfast that followed the sunrise. We will never forget this day.Hi Nancy,

Thank you very much for taking an Himalayan walking experience with us. Glad to know Pankaj made your best experience for you. We are extremely looking forward to serve you next time for longer holidays that we have specilized best Nepal trekking here. Have a nice time. Namaste!Great view of the sunrise on the morning and a nice walk after with a great tour guide and interesting tour of temple. Hi,

Thank you for sharing your experience and glad that you loved this trip. we are extremely looking for future trip in Nepal again. Namaste!
highlight: A sunrise Nagarkot trip with Changu Narayan hike
Enjoy panoramic views over the Himalayas, followed by a gentle guided hike
Stop along the route to enjoy local Newari delicacies in family-run shops
Spend time exploring the UNESCO-listed temple that most visitors miss

data.name: Jungle Towernight Stay In Chitwan National Park ,nepal-2 Nights 3 Days Package
data.about:
After the  busy Katmandu, coming here to The Park and staying with Sangam at the resort has been something I will always remember. 10/10 experience like no other. Thankyou to Repal my expert jungle guide and his security guide. This will rate amongst my top trips ever. The animals and the national park are majestic!Dear James ,   

Namaste  

Thank you for choosing The towernight stay with us .  

Thank you for the amazing review . 
  
Welcoming you in Chitwan and serving you with the jungle tour was amazing for us .  

Connecting with you was memorable through the jungle tour .  

See you soon in near future  

Regards
SangamThe opportunity to get up close and personal with the river and jungle environment and it's species made this a much richer experience we went down river for 45 minutes seeing a variety of birds and crocodiles. Redis embarked and hiked on trail 45 minutes seeing a massive rhinoceros eating grass next to the trail. The tower itself is exactly correct. A three-story structure embedded in the jungle. We observe multiple bird species. Monkeys in the trees fell asleep to the sounds of the forest. Highly recommendedDear Michael ,

Thank you for the amazing review .

data.name: Everest Base Camp Trek - 14 Days
data.about: We had a fantastic time during this trek in off-season. We wanted to make sure to pick a Nepali company, all the admin was arranged making it super easy for us and our guide Pasang and porter Gombu were perfect calm company and supported us with absolutely everything the whole way, perhaps it‚Äôs possible to ask for their services when you book. Big recommendation and we‚Äôll come again! Had an amazing time trekking to EBC with Ace The Himalaya. Both our guide Pasang and porter Gombu made this trek unforgettable and were very caring during the 14 days !!We decided to go off season to avoid too much crowd and although not sunny at all times, much recommended!Overall, very very good experience When I decided to embark my journey for Everest Base Camp, the so called EBC Trek, I wanted to make sure about the quality of organisers and did extensive research to figure out so many positive reviews about ACE the Himalayas. It was a group trek which taught me how to be the part of group which had 2 Americans, 2 Britishers, 2 Iranians, 2 Canadians , 2 Romanians and 2 IndiansFor someone who always believes it‚Äôs all about mindset and I could complete it without any preparation, I would surely call it moderate to difficult trek both mentally and physically, considering the 5K+ altitudeFrom landing on worlds most dangerous airport Lukla üõ´to Phakding to have fooseball game ‚öΩÔ∏èwith beers üçªto Namche Bazar along with Everest view Hotel Trek üèûÔ∏èto Tighboce where we had our first sight of mightly Mt Everest üèîÔ∏èand Lohtseto Dingboche to have some awesome coffee ‚òïÔ∏è to hike to Nangkartshang Peakto Labuche to feel the atmosphere with super thin air and able to survive the same ü•∂‚ùÑÔ∏èto Gorak Shep to drop our bags to reach EBC and witness the world mightiest Mountain EVEREST also from Kala Patthar ü•æAll of this makes EBC trek one of best and most memorable adventures of my lifeCheers to all fellow hikers for reaching new heights both on mountains and in our personal lives. See you soon matesPS: Thanks to our Guide Raj and Assistant Guide Dilip who were patient enough to tell names of all the peaks again and again and made this trek possible üôÇRaj had great knowledge about medication, equipment and weather. When a few members of our trip fell sick his team took care of them to the highest. He and his team always ensure our safety and comfort. I never felt it was rushed at any moment as you can imagine during any organised tripDilip has all the qualities of becoming a trek leader soon and all the very best brotherPS: Special thanks to all our sherpas who made it possible by carrying our duffle bags so that we could sleep comfortably during the entire trek ü´°When you plan such a lifetime experience, you definitely need a team like Ace, I wish ACE team a big Thank You as because of your guys 12 people have been able to ACE the Himalayas EBC Trek :)A GREAT EXPERIENCE our guide Aamod Nepal and Poter kumar were wonderful, kind and patient with us. We had a good experience Amod went at our pace which was great. We were taken great care off from our arrive until our departure excellent service and care. All questions were answered to the best of their ability.Thank you guys.I recently had the opportunity to embark on a mesmerizing 14-day trek to Everest Base Camp with the exceptional team at Ace the Himalaya. Our guide, Pasang, was an absolute gem, sharing captivating stories and ensuring our safety. Special shoutout to the porters Gopal, Hem and Ihakpa who amazed us with their strength and kindness. The organization was flawless, with comfortable accommodations and delicious meals. This trek was truly remarkable, exceeding all expectations. I highly recommend Ace the Himalaya for an unforgettable Himalayan adventure.I have only good things to say about my experience trekking to EBC with Ace Himalaya! Our guide Raj and assistant guide Soumun were kind, supportive and patient throughout the trip. We had a mix of ages and experience levels in our group, but throughout the climb we felt supported, encouraged and most importantly we felt safe. When members of our group were feeling sick, Raj and Soumun helped us talk through our symptoms, provided medication and calmed our doubts. Raj had great medical knowledge and equipment and provide us with medication, daily oxygen saturation checks which helped ease some of our tensions. Additionally the guides helped us set a great pace throughout the course of the entire hike, making the harder days feel more manageable. The trek itself was absolutely beautiful! The views were unbeatable and the opportunity to meet people from all over the world during the hike was incredible. This was the trip of a lifetime, so thank you Ace!!I‚Äôm not sure where to begin here! There were so many wonderful things about my trek with Ace the Himalaya tour group.  For starters, I am 61 years old and in relatively fit shape.  There‚Äôs always room for improvement, as one can never prepare entirely for a huge altitude hike, such as the EBC trek.  This was my first ever altitude trek of this magnitude.Raj, our guide and Narin, our porter were incredibly, kind, respectful patient and knowledgeable.  Raj was funny and certainly knew how to make me feel confident and strong.He even insisted on carrying my day pack, along with his own large backpack many of the tekking days, to save my energy.   Unfortunately, I suffered from altitude sickness and a head cold much of the trek, but continued to trek onward and upward with Raj‚Äôs encouragement and belief in me that I could complete this journey, and I did!!!! The views are stunning, the support and camaraderie  among the other trekkers on the trail was inspirational.  Embracing the Nepalese people, food and culture is unforgettable.Look no farther, Ace the Himalaya is your trekking company. They are stellar.  Truly, don‚Äôt waste your time looking at other Trekking companies to the EBC.I would definitely go with them again for other treks.  They are highly professional and reasonably priced.I‚Äôve traveled all over the world and have done many different treks along the way. Ace the Himalaya was absolutely brilliant! I loved the attention to detail and the care that was provided to my friend and I. Raj was an extraordinary guide who saw to our every need and gently encouraged us along the way while having fun. Narayan was our gentle and patient porter who went above and beyond his duties. Consider yourself lucky if you get these two men as your guide and porter, they are indeed wonderful! I will never forget this trip to Everest Base Camp and  am already thinking about booking another adventure with Ace in the future! Thank you Raj and the Ace team!Incredible experience. Our guide Nimesh was absolutely fantastic - answered every question we had, was with us 24/7 and helped through every difficulty we encountered. He also gave fantastic tips  that made the hight acclimatization much easier.The organization of the trek was spot on - i never once felt like we were stuck or was lacking for anything. On one of the days when we felt we could walk for more than was planned - Nimesh and ace the himalaya very quickly organized a guesthouse in the next village so we  could continue walking on.Ace the himalaya made sure we also got on the first flights in and out of lukla - seeing as any slight change in weather can cause serious delays, making sure we were booked for the earliest flight made the start and end of the trek as smooth as possible.Ace and Nimesh made sure this was a fantastic experience, and that apart from the walking itself i didn't have to worry about anything.Great Views and Amazing experience. Trek was strenuous, Guides Raj and Souman made it easier.  They provided us with great guidance, clean water and amazing food. Srujan helped us organize the trip and provided great support. Ace the Himalaya is the best!!!

reviews.text: We had a fantastic time during this trek in off-season. We wanted to make sure to pick a Nepali company, all the admin was arranged making it super easy for us and our guide Pasang and porter Gombu were perfect calm company and supported us with absolutely everything the whole way, perhaps it‚Äôs possible to ask for their services when you book. Big recommendation and we‚Äôll come again!

reviews.name: BENZAID S
reviews.text: Had an amazing time trekking to EBC with Ace The Himalaya. Both our guide Pasang and porter Gombu made this trek unforgettable and were very caring during the 14 days !!We decided to go off season to avoid too much crowd and although not sunny at all times, much recommended!Overall, very very good experience

reviews.name: heyrk1502
reviews.text: When I decided to embark my journey for Everest Base Camp, the so called EBC Trek, I wanted to make sure about the quality of organisers and did extensive research to figure out so many positive reviews about ACE the Himalayas. It was a group trek which taught me how to be the part of group which had 2 Americans, 2 Britishers, 2 Iranians, 2 Canadians , 2 Romanians and 2 IndiansFor someone who always believes it‚Äôs all about mindset and I could complete it without any preparation, I would surely call it moderate to difficult trek both mentally and physically, considering the 5K+ altitudeFrom landing on worlds most dangerous airport Lukla üõ´to Phakding to have fooseball game ‚öΩÔ∏èwith beers üçªto Namche Bazar along with Everest view Hotel Trek üèûÔ∏èto Tighboce where we had our first sight of mightly Mt Everest üèîÔ∏èand Lohtseto Dingboche to have some awesome coffee ‚òïÔ∏è to hike to Nangkartshang Peakto Labuche to feel the atmosphere with super thin air and able to survive the same ü•∂‚ùÑÔ∏èto Gorak Shep to drop our bags to reach EBC and witness the world mightiest Mountain EVEREST also from Kala Patthar ü•æAll of this makes EBC trek one of best and most memorable adventures of my lifeCheers to all fellow hikers for reaching new heights both on mountains and in our personal lives. See you soon matesPS: Thanks to our Guide Raj and Assistant Guide Dilip who were patient enough to tell names of all the peaks again and again and made this trek possible üôÇRaj had great knowledge about medication, equipment and weather. When a few members of our trip fell sick his team took care of them to the highest. He and his team always ensure our safety and comfort. I never felt it was rushed at any moment as you can imagine during any organised tripDilip has all the qualities of becoming a trek leader soon and all the very best brotherPS: Special thanks to all our sherpas who made it possible by carrying our duffle bags so that we could sleep comfortably during the entire trek ü´°When you plan such a lifetime experience, you definitely need a team like Ace, I wish ACE team a big Thank You as because of your guys 12 people have been able to ACE the Himalayas EBC Trek :)

reviews.name: Shenai B
reviews.text: A GREAT EXPERIENCE our guide Aamod Nepal and Poter kumar were wonderful, kind and patient with us. We had a good experience Amod went at our pace which was great. We were taken great care off from our arrive until our departure excellent service and care. All questions were answered to the best of their ability.Thank you guys.

reviews.name: Shreya S
reviews.text: I recently had the opportunity to embark on a mesmerizing 14-day trek to Everest Base Camp with the exceptional team at Ace the Himalaya. Our guide, Pasang, was an absolute gem, sharing captivating stories and ensuring our safety. Special shoutout to the porters Gopal, Hem and Ihakpa who amazed us with their strength and kindness. The organization was flawless, with comfortable accommodations and delicious meals. This trek was truly remarkable, exceeding all expectations. I highly recommend Ace the Himalaya for an unforgettable Himalayan adventure.

data.name: Bhaktapur and Nagarkot Day Tour From Kathmandu
data.price: from $60.00 per adult (price varies by group size)
data.about:
Amazing historical tour of Bhaktapur.  Dipesh was very knowledgeable of the history and gave us an in depth tour of Bhaktapur with explanations of all the temples.  Weather wasn‚Äôt good but we still made an effort to see the view from Nagarkot.  Drive was something else!  Highly recommend this tour.Thank you, Kimberly! We're delighted to hear that you had an amazing historical tour of Bhaktapur with Dipesh. Our team takes pride in providing knowledgeable guides who can make your experience informative and enjoyable. Despite the weather, we're glad you made an effort to see the view from Nagarkot and had a memorable drive. Your recommendation means a lot to us, and we hope to welcome you back for more incredible tours in the future!Our guide Dipesh was Excellent.  Very informative and told us all about the History.  He was Very good.  Driver also was good.David, thank you for sharing your experience with us! We are thrilled to hear that Dipesh, our guide for the Bhaktapur and Nagarkot Tour, exceeded your expectations. His informative and engaging explanations about the history truly made the tour special. Our team takes pride in providing knowledgeable guides who can enrich your journey.

We're also glad that our driver contributed to your positive experience. Safety and comfort are always a priority for us, and we're pleased to know that our driver's service met your expectations.

Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we hope to have the pleasure of hosting you on more memorable tours in the future! Until then, safe travels and best wishes from all of us.This tour gives you stunning views and plenty of history! My guide Dipesh was extremely knowledgeable about Nepal‚Äôs history and the relevance of each major site we visited. On this tour, you‚Äôre bound to find something you truly enjoy!Thank you, Amy! We're thrilled to hear that you had an amazing tour of Bhaktapur and Nagarkot with Dipesh as your guide. His extensive knowledge of Nepal's history and the major sites truly enhances the experience. We're glad you enjoyed the stunning views and the rich history during the tour. Your feedback is greatly appreciated, and we hope to welcome you back for more enjoyable adventures in the future!Our guide Dipak was excellent and very knowledgeable and our driver was absolutely brilliant. The transportation was excellent and the local food was very tasty. Bhaktapur Durbar Square- a place everyone must visit during their stay in Kathmandu ‚Ä¶. highly recommend!Thank you, Sangi! We're thrilled to hear that you had an excellent experience on the Bhaktapur and Nagarkot Day tour with Dipak as your guide. Our team takes pride in providing knowledgeable and friendly guides to make your visit memorable. We're also glad to know that you enjoyed the transportation and the tasty local food. Bhaktapur Durbar Square is indeed a must-visit place, and we highly recommend it too! Your feedback means a lot to us, and we hope to welcome you back for more wonderful experiences in the future! Amazing trip to Nagarkot and Bhaktapur with Dipesh as our guide. He was so knowledgeable, helpful, and very patient with all our questions. Even provided us with water on this hot July day and a great rooftop restaurant recommendation! Our driver was also excellent at navigating the hills on the way to Nagarkot. It was a great day! Thank you!Thank you, JMcB! We're thrilled to hear that you had a great day tour to Nagarkot and Bhaktapur with Dipesh as your guide. Providing excellent service and ensuring your comfort are our top priorities. We're glad that Dipesh's knowledge and helpfulness made the trip amazing for your family. It's great to know that our driver's skills were appreciated as well. We hope to welcome you back for more wonderful experiences in the future! Highly recommended for culture and history buffs who love typical architecture and temples. Guide Subash (very knowledgeable)  and driver Ram made a nice  trip for me!!Really appreciated the historical insights and illustrative descriptions of our guide. Even though it was overcast in Nagorkot, the trip to Bhaktapur more than made up for it. Would definitely recommend this to any travelers who want to do a quick one-day tour of this historical site!The tour is two parts- first you drive up the mountain to a mountain-top lookout where on a clear day you can see Mt. Everest, unfortunately between smog and clouds we were not able to see much of anything when we reached the top but the drive up was amazing.  The second part of the tour has your guide take you through Bhaktapur and tell you about the various temples and sites within the square.  I would have loved to have heard more about the mountain way of life, but I think our group was too talkative amongst ourselves that we lost some of the time with the guide.  The van was spacious compared to normal Nepalese cabs and the driver was a pro at handling Nepalese traffic.I had a remarkable tour guide who provided a walking history narration of these two UNESCO sites. I learned a lot, asked a lot of questions, and I was also introduced to Nepalese yogurt (you haven‚Äôt had anything better, trust me). Madan was my guide and I can not recommend him enough. I‚Äôve used guides in several venues and I think he is the best I‚Äôve worked with. You will have a marvelous time in the hands of a easy-going, knowledgeable professional!Madan was my guide for the day tour.  He took me to Nagarkot where he explained the life of the people living in the mountains.  He also introduced the history and culture of Nepal in an interesting way.  I even had the chance to taste the wild berries on the hill side.  In Bhaktapur, Madan showed me the various temples and told me the interesting history and stories of all the places we visited.  I even tried the local yogurt which was very tasty.  Overall I had a few hours of enjoyable time with Madan who is a professional and knowledgeable guide.

data.name: UNESCO Seven World Heritage Tour in Kathmandu
data.price: from $180.00 per adult (price varies by group size)
data.about:
Loved the tour! We spent the day making our way across the city visiting the many temples and districts of Kathmandu... (The monkey temple was the favorite!) We arrived just in time to see the Royal Kumari. (Which many people missed out on!) We had a nice lunch at a temple cafe, and had some tasty homemade candy as wandered through some really interesting areas! The guide, Shanti, was VERY knowledgeable and managed to navigate us through the crowds and to rain with ease! Thank you for the spectacular tour!Hi,

Thank you very much for taking service with us and glad to know our guide Shanti able to offer you good service and information about the trip. we are extremely looking forward to see you again in the future. Namaste!I was very pleased to be accompanied by Shanti, amazing tour guide and very knowledgeable lady, as she has her degree in Nepal history! Any question I had she was able to explain. The program is very full and active, so you need to rest well before going, please mind that! We visited  many squares and temples around Kathmandu, but I enjoyed  Bakhtapur the most (not only because we had lunch there)) - it is more of a peaceful place. One of the tour highlights was that we were able to see royal Kumari in her house, quite a rare event. Another one was visiting Pashupatinath Temple in Kathmandu, where we could witness Hindu cremation ritual, sight not for the light heart. I would certainly advise you going for this amazing day tour)Hi Ksenia,

Thank you very much for taking service with us and glad to know our guide Shanti were able to offer you good service and information during the tour. We love to offer you multi-days tour in future and feel free to come back for amazing cultural experience in Nepal. Have a nice nice and Namaste!If you want to see everything Kathmandu has to offer in one day, this is the tour for you!  Rabina was our guide and she did a great job! We were able to see everything we wanted to see plus more! They were very accommodating to our schedule and were willing to meet us a little bit later due to a cancellation with a previous appointment that day. Thank yo so much for making our trip memorable in Nepal!Hi Chris,

Thank you very much for for booking a trip with us and glad to know you loved this trip with Rabina. We are extremely looking forward to serve you again in the future and thank you once again for sharing your experience here. Namaste!I was only able to spend 5 days in Nepal and I wanted to visit all UNESCO world heritage sites. The tour was excellent and we were able to cover all sites in about 10 hours (might be longer in a bigger group, I traveled alone). My tour guide, Rabina, was very friendly and helpful answering all my questions regarding the history of the sites and Nepal culture in general. I really appreciated that I was able to take my time when I wanted to spend more time at one site, and did not feel pressured by the itinerary schedule. Hi Adrian,

Thank you very much for booking a trip with us and enjoying this trip with our guide Rabina. Glad to know you loved this trip. We hope to see you again for longer holidays in Nepal and feel free to contact us again. Namaste!Great experience. It was a 6h long visit with great details on the history of the places. Would definitely recommend if you like learning about monuments!Hi,

Thank you very much for booking a trip with us and glad to know you loved this trip with us. We hope to see you again for longer holidays in Nepal and feel free to contact us again. Namaste!Amazing! We spent a wonderful day with Rabina touring the UNESCO sites! This is a must do in Kathmandu and Rabina was excellent. She answered all of my questions with patience and is such a wealth of knowledge for culture, history and religion. This tour is a must do in Kathmandu. Clean car, safe driver, great English speaking tour guide. Highly recommend, 5 stars! Hi,

Thank you very much for booking a trip with us and glad to know you loved this trip with our guide Rabina. We hope to see you again for longer holidays in Nepal and feel free to contact us again. Namaste!I had a great day with Shanti. She is an expert in both Nepal history and culture, and really experienced giving tours, knowing the best ways/times to negotiate the sights and the best places for views/pictures. We even saw the Kumari! Thanks so much, Shanti!Hi Jessica,

Thank you very much for booking a trip with us and glad to know you loved this trip with our guide Shanti. We hope to see you again in the future for longer holidays in Nepal and feel free to contact again. Namaste!Had a fantastic day trip, informative, friendly guide, excellent english. Driver and car great. Highly recommendThank you very much for sharing a wonderful experience about our team and service. Looking forward to your further recommendation and love to see you again in Nepal for longer holiday. Namaste!Shanti Karki was an amazing guide!  Shanti is a history major and when I told her I am a geek for knowledge about the places I travel she gave me all the educational information and history and insight into Buddhist and Hindu cultures that I was for once totally satiated!She totally catered the tour to what I wanted to do and even gave me time to have butter tea and chat with the monks at the monkey temple!   Shanti was kind and considerate and really good at helping me get the most out of my experience - and not get my glasses stolen by mischievous monkeys :-) I highly recommend this tour and especially Shanti Karki!And a HUGE shout out to our driver Narayan Shrestha! He navigated the streets of Kathmandu and the surrounding area like a pro and I never once felt nervous with him at the helm!Thanks to both of them I had a wonderful day!!Hi Amber,

Thank you very much for sharing a wonderful experience about our team and service. Looking forward to your further recommendation and love to see you again in Nepal for longer holiday. Namaste!I had a wonderful tour with Shanti visiting the seven world heritage sites around the Kathmandu valley. Shanti was full of information and was always checking in with me to make sure things were going well. This tour is a definite must do.Hi Dan,

It is our pleasure to serve you in this cultural & heritage Planet of the Kathmandu Valley. Thank you for trusting us as your local operator here and glad to know our guide Shanti able to offer you good service and sharing depth knowledge of the all sites of Kathmandu. We are extremely looking forward to your recommendation who love to visit Kathmandu. Namaste!

data.name: Nagarkot Sunrise and Bhaktapur Durbar Squar UNESCO Tour
data.price: from $75.00 per adult (price varies by group size)
data.about: We had an amazing time in this tour. We were able to see a different side of Nepal, watching the city at night on our way to Nagarkot to see the sunrise. The driver was fast but safe, and the guide was incredibly knowledgeable about everything in Bhaktapur Durbar Square. He took us to an amazing cafe where we were able to look over two amazing temples. Highly Recommend for an amazing morning in the Kathmandu Valley. data.name: Day Trip to Bhaktapur and Panauti from Kathmandu
data.about: We really enjoyed our tour to Bhaktapur and Panauti. The drive was very comfortable and we enjoyed looking round Bhaktapur despite the rain. Our guide, Akshay, was very knowledgeable about the history of the area and knew lots of stories too. He taloured the tour to our interests, trying some Juju Dhau and pottery making!Lunch at our homestay was delicious and included trying our hand at some cooking!Thank you!Bhaktapur is definitely worth visiting. Our guide, Akshay made it even more interesting; he was very knowledgeable and fun to interact with. He organized lunch with a local family, it was very authentic  and a nice surprise; food was tasty and it felt good to support the local community. The day was nice and relaxed l, we never felt pressured for time and Akshay was ready to answer all our questions. We learned a lot about the area and the history of Nepal, we recommend this tour and our guide Akshay.I had a great experience with Jumo, and she brought me around with much insights to offer. She was very knowledgeable on the places and culture, and even shared some history of how the places evolved over the years. Loved this tour and will definitely recommend it to people looking for a short half day tour outside of Kathmandu.We had a wonderful day with our tour guide, Akshay and our driver who kept us safe in the chaotic traffic of Nepal. Akshay, was competent, knowledgeable, and made it a lot of fun with his humor.  The tour was well paced, visiting all the historical sites with time to browse and do a little shopping and snacking on delicious freshly made yogurt.  A special highlight was the homestay lunch in Panauti. I was the best Dal Bhat we had in all of Nepal! I highly recommend adding this tour to your visit.Dilip was an excellent tour guide. He could answer all our questions and had a deep knowledge about religion and culture.Great tour to explore the outskirt of the Kathmandu valley! Given the size of the grounds its worth it to have a tour guide. Ours, Dilip, was amazing!A wonderfully authentic experience of Bhaktapur and Panauti. Having a Dal Bhat lunch prepared and shared with us by a local Nepali family in Panauti was a highlight of our trip.Very well organised day trip from Kathmandu. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area. Both places are heritage listed. Tour guide was great.It was one of the best tours I have ever done! I would highly recommend it. From the moment of departure to the end, everything is worth it. From the meeting point a van came to pick us up, super clean and air-conditioned. Our guide (the nicest person I have ever met!) started to tell us about the route we were going to do, and during the way (1 hour and a half to Panauti) she filled us with beautiful stories about her culture. During the rest of the tour, he answered all our questions, she went to the shops and showed us what they use everything for, and she gave us all the time in the world to stop and take pictures, I even enjoyed a pottery class, and tasted a typical yogurt dessert.Thanks for everything! Very nice! The guide and driver were very friendly. The places were beautiful and it was nice to hear the stories behind the places that we visited.
